item.title: Sara add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is to be enjoyed, not endured" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Sara add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Well, art is art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water! And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now, uh... now you tell me what you know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sara add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Sara add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Sara add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sara add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally. " -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Sara add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "My tastes are simple: I am easily satisfied with the best." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Sara add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "You see, freedom has a way of destroying things." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Sara add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Those who deny freedom to others deserve it not for themselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sara add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sara add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Sara add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Sara add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Sara add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Sara add a quote by ernest hemingway
item.description: "Courage is grace under pressure." -- ernest hemingway

item.title: Sara add a quote by Ambrose Redmoon
item.description: "Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear." -- Ambrose Redmoon

item.title: Sara add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of not having the courage to be an absolute nobody." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Sara add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "A man with outward courage dares to die; a man with inner courage dares to live." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Sara add a quote by E.F. Schumacher
item.description: "Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius — and a lot of courage to move in the opposite direction." -- E.F. Schumacher

item.title: Sara add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Sara add a quote by Confucious
item.description: "By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest." -- Confucious

item.title: Sara add a quote by William Stafford
item.description: "Wisdom is having things right in your life and knowing why." -- William Stafford

item.title: Sara add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sara add a quote by Michel Legrand
item.description: "The more I live, the more I learn. The more I learn, the more I realize, the less I know." -- Michel Legrand

item.title: Sara add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Wars are poor chisels for carving out peaceful tomorrows." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sara add a quote by Einstein
item.description: "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy." -- Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Sara add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "If the events of September 11, 2001, have proven anything, it's that the terrorists can attack us, but they can't take away what makes us American -- our freedom, our liberty, our civil rights. No, only Attorney General John Ashcroft can do that." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Sara add a quote by Stephen Hawking
item.description: "Even if there is only one possible unified theory, it is just a set of rules and equations. What is it that breathes fire into the equations and makes a universe for them to describe? The usual approach of science of constructing a mathematical model cannot answer the questions of why there should be a universe for the model to describe. Why does the universe go to all the bother of existing?" -- Stephen Hawking

item.title: Sara add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx
